5. We hear a lot about the troubles the #Ebola response is facing ‚Äî case contacts refusing vaccine or fleeing & spreading Ebola to a new location. But this week's Situation Report has some nice news: +90% of people offered vaccine agree to be vaccinated. Little miracle, that. https://t.co/BXPXe7v6aG

4. Another question: Has the trial of experimental #Ebola drugs been halted because of the recent attacks on treatment centers? The past 4 weekly Situation Reports have said 66 patients have been enrolled in the trial. There've been more cases. Why is the number unchanged? https://t.co/mmz3yg6s9m

3. A lot ‚Äî +40,000 ‚Äî of health workers & front line workers in the #Ebola-affected DRC provinces as well as in neighboring areas & countries have been vaccinated with the experimental vaccines. Rwanda, however, still hasn't started, despite weeks of saying "soon." Why? https://t.co/oXqi4zXhfr

2. The number of health workers infected in this #Ebola outbreak has risen again. It now stands at 74 infections, 26 deaths. This from this week's Situation Report from @WHOAFRO.
